# Open Responses

> Open Responses is an open, vendor-neutral specification for large language model APIs that defines a shared schema, consistent streaming/events, and extensible tooling to enable interoperable LLM workflows across different providers. It standardizes LLM interfaces while maintaining flexibility for provider-specific extensions and advanced agentic capabilities.

## Resources

- [API Reference](https://www.openresponses.org/reference): Detailed API documentation with all endpoints, parameters, and response structures
- [Specification](https://www.openresponses.org/specification): Complete technical specification with detailed concepts and implementation guidelines
- [Compliance](https://www.openresponses.org/compliance): Acceptance tests and validation procedures
- [Governance](https://www.openresponses.org/governance): Technical charter and governance structure
- [Changelog](https://www.openresponses.org/changelog): Version history and updates

## Documentation

- [Overview](https://www.openresponses.org/): Introduction to Open Responses
- [Specification](https://www.openresponses.org/specification): Complete technical specification
- [API Reference](https://www.openresponses.org/reference): Detailed API documentation
- [Compliance](https://www.openresponses.org/compliance): Acceptance tests and validation
- [Governance](https://www.openresponses.org/governance): Technical charter and governance structure
- [Changelog](https://www.openresponses.org/changelog): Version history and updates

## Examples

- [cURL Snippets](https://www.openresponses.org/curl_snippets/curl_snippets.yaml): YAML file with cURL examples for various API calls
- [OpenAPI Specification](https://www.openresponses.org/openapi/openapi.json): Complete OpenAPI specification in JSON format
